She also grabbed a jar of mayonnaise from the door before closing the icebox behind her.

Bulma filled two pots with water and sat down as she patiently waited for them to boil. Bulma woke up a few hours later when her stomach violently rumbled. She clenched her pudgy stomach and shifted herself into an upright position. Even though she wasn't able to flush her waste, she refused to just do her business on the floor like an animal. She was far too civilized to indulge in such a behavior.

The blue-haired beauty then pulled back the browning shower curtain to reveal her real toilet. Since the regular one had been out of order for the last few weeks, Bulma had started doing her business in the basin of the bathtub. The drain had been clogged early on, so it was about a quarter-way full. Bulma pulled her shorts off her wide hips and down her chunky legs. She had forgone panties a while back because they were too much of a hassle to deal with. She bent over, placing her shapely ass on the rim of the tub and proceeded to push. Chi-Chi crawled alongside Bulma, being guided outside and into the car. Luckily, Bulma had made sure the doors were expanded, owning a rich company. She thought she should do this if the time ever came where they needed to leave the house. Well, that time had come

Bulma knew that she should also get a leash with the food, just in case she had to bear walking again. However, Chi-Chi was becoming rather annoying to put up with during the mere walk to the car. She would stop crawling just to sit and scratch behind her ear, even though Bulma wanted to get this done as soon as possible.

Chi-Chi would lift her leg up and attempt to pee ON the object, only for her to wet herself/dress even more. Bulma had never changed Chi-Chi's clothes. The obese moron had been in the same, overstretched, purple dress since her ordeal had begun. It was smelly and covered with stains ranging from food to sweat to even her own waste. Chi-Chi lifted her leg and tried to pee on her "territory" only to end up peeing on her dress again, not even knowing that she was.

Lastly, Chi-Chi would attempt to chase after any garbage or recycling bins they were unfortunate enough to pass by. Obviously, Bulma would pull her sidekick away from the trashcans and bins she would chase, which would be a struggle due to how heavy Chi-Chi was. All this irritated Bulma highly. 112111111111.content:
Bulma finally shoved Chi-Chi into the backseat of her car, slamming the door shut behind her. She leaned against the car, taking the opportunity to catch her breath. She let her flabby back sag against the door and began to slide down into a sitting position; leaving a slimy trail of sweat in her wake. Her descent forced her shirt up, revealing her bulbous, stretch mark-covered gut. All that exercise left her wheezing and drenched. Why did she have to leave the couch?

She quickly got her answer as her stomach quaked, sending ripples and vibrations throughout her tubby body. The pain was intense, like she hadn't eaten in days. She clutched her gut before her hands went to work on kneading it. After a few minutes on the floor, the hunger pangs stopped. However, Bulma knew this solution would only be temporary. She needed food and she needed it now! She pulled the car keys out of the overstretched cup of her tank top and manually unlocked the front door. The moment she opened it, she was violently smacked with the smell of Chi-Chi. In the short time Bulma had been out of commission, her pet had already managed to hotbox the vehicle, complete with earthy musk and greenish haze. Normally the smell wouldn't get to her. But the small space had concentrated it, making the previously disgusting scent absolutely noxious.

Bulma retched a bit on all fours and let the air escape from the car. She waited a couple more minutes, but the smell was still lingering. Any thought of waiting longer was quickly interrupted by the groan of her stomach. Realizing she couldn't wait anymore, she covered her nose and made a move. As she inched her way into the car seat like an overinflated slug, her eyes began to water. It was like being in a room filled with freshly cut onions. But as the threat of starvation crept closer and closer, Bulma fought through it. She stuck the key in the ignition and rolled down the windows. She then slammed her foot on the gas and sped to the nearest food serving establishment.

1121111111111.content:
Written by Joey1212:

Bulma had reasoned that so long as she does her best to ignore Chi-Chi's odor, the ride should at least be tolerable. Unfortunately for her, she was dead wrong. Chi-Chi kept adding to the smell with her gas, and would keep pooping and pissing herself. This made the need for a diaper for her more apparent. Chi-Chi would also ask stupid questions along the way.

"Blue lady, why sky big?" was an example. "Why me belly have hole with food in it?" is another one she asked while she was picking her bellybutton for a meal. She scoted on the backseat, ruining the cushions with her smell, sweat, and waste as her rump would rub against the seat.

Bulma was so hoping they were almost there. She has to remember to scold Chi-Chi for her behavior when they get home.
1121111111111.title: Continue

11211111111111.content:
Bulma pulled up by the entrance of the local supermarket. She knew she didn't have the strength or patience to walk from a parking spot. She cracked the windows in the car and locked the door behind her, hoping Chi-Chi would be to stupid to find a way out. She then moved as quickly as her swollen thighs allowed her and plopped into a scooter-cart normally occupied by people twice her size. By the time she sat down, she was already exhausted and covered in sweat. "God, I really need to get back in shape", she heaved to herself before releasing a massive belch and having her circular stomach grumble. She had already attracted a few stares from passing customers, causing her to flush with embarrassment. She may have accepted her situation, or was at least too lazy to do anything about it, but she was still very insecure about showing her figure in public. So she sheepishly waved at some onlookers and zipped away on her scooter to find some food.

After wasting her time preparing breakfast that morning, Bulma thought it would be best to only get food that she didn't have to cook. She filled the front of her cart with cookies, pastries, chips, TV dinners, frozen pizza, soda, candy, and lots and lots of alcohol; the way things were going with Chi-Chi, she was going to need it. Then she went to the pet aisle to get some more slop for the animal she had in the car. Bulma had clearly saved the worst for last, since not only would she have to stand up and bend over to get to the bottom shelf, she would have to lift the twenty lb. bags all by herself. She just knew it would strain her poor little muscles. Luckily for her, a cute pink-hair girl about her age saw her struggling to push herself off of her seat.

"Oh, don't worry sweetie. Let me grab that for you.", she said with a peppy smile on her face. Bulma watched as the athletic woman bent down and pulled out the twenty lb. weight and slung it over her shoulder. She saw the muscle definition flex in her legs when she bent down. She couldn't help but be a bit jealous and envious, especially since she once had a body just as fit. Just the sight of this thin girl with her perky tits, flat stomach and tight ass, wearing nothing but a pair of booty-shorts and a crop-top made Bulma feel even worse about herself.

"So, I'm guessing you've got a dog of your own, huh?"

"Something like that", Bulma said with a shy smile.

"How many do you have?"

"Just one, but she eats a lot".

"Oh, then I guess I better grab another bag for you. Don't want the poor pup to go hungry."

"Thanks", Bulma said as she watched this girl stick her small bottom in the air again as she bent over for another bag.

"If you don't mind me asking, what breed do you have?" The bubbly girl asked.

Bulma hesitated before responding, "It's called a Chi-Chi. It's a really rare breed".

"Wow, that's so cool. All I've got is a boring old Golden Retriever. It must be awesome having an exotic pet".

"Trust me, it's not as great as it sounds".

"Well, I'd love to see it sometime. Maybe I can come over and you can show me! Darn it, I'm such a spaz. I'm inviting myself over and I didn't even tell you my name yet. I'm Roxie."

"I'm Bulma, nice to meet you", it was then that Bulma had an idea. Roxie was happy to help her before and eager to see her 'rare breed'. The bad part about getting all this food was having to unload it, at the register and at the car. "Ya know Roxie, my pet is in the car out front. I'd be happy to show her to you if you can help me with all these groceries. I'd do it myself, but taking care of such a unique creature has left me far too tired."

"Really? Great. I'll be happy to help you".

"Excellent", Bulma said with a sly grin, happy to know that while her body may have changed, her mind was sharp as ever.

Bulma gladly lounged back in her scooter as Roxie did all the work for her. She could get used to someone waiting on her hand and foot. Maybe she'd hire a butler one day. The two quickly finished and made there way out of the store towards Bulma's car. Roxie had to cover her nose as they drew nearer, as the stench was powerful even from a distance. Her eyes began to water as the green mist oozing out of the cracked windows got to her. Bulma was getting a bit nervous, fearing that Roxie would run away, leaving her to unpack the groceries by herself.
11211111111111.title: Continue

112111111111111.content:
Written by Joey1212:

Once Bulma and Roxie opened the door, Chi-Chi looked at them with a doofy grin, while farting once again

The latter couldn't help but smile. She felt glad to have some help from someone who didn't immediately shun her
"So, how'd your friend here turn out rather... " Roxie struggled to think of a gentle way to describe Chi-Chi
"Retarded? Well, we were friends for a long time. But then I walked into her house one day and found her like this," answered Bulma, finishing Roxie's sentence

"Ah! So you took her in? That's rather sweet of you," complimented Roxie. Bulma couldn't help but blush, before getting into the car. Roxie came along, sitting in the front with Bulma. Chi-Chi would say incoherent phrases or release more foul smells, but over time, Bulma and Roxie started to adapt to the stench. It wasn't long before the trio reached home.

"Hey! Blue lady! Look what me do!" Chi-Chi pointed her butt towards Bulma and farted while pointing at it with her finger. Chi-Chi clearly was acting like she never farted before, let alone heard of one. She was acting very excited, like her fart was a magic trick, forgetting that she does one almost every second. Bulma was sick of Chi-Chi's idiocy at this point

"Listen, Chi-Chi! I've had it with--"

"Now, now, Bulma. She doesn't know any better. We should be kind and appease her behavior," said Roxie, stopping Bulma from ranting. Roxie looked over to Chi-Chi with a smile. "That's a great trick you did there, Chi-Chi! Maybe you should teach me to do that someday," said Roxie, while stroking Chi-Chi's messy hair, making her pant like a happy puppy.

"Me like nice lady," commented Chi-Chi. Bulma was baffled by how Roxie handled he situation. Maybe she should be a little nicer to Chi-Chi.

1121111111111111.content:
The three of them got back to the house and Bulma and Roxie started unloading the car. After putting the groceries on the counter, they let Chi-Chi out the back and let her run back inside as fast as her stubby little legs could carry her. Now that everything was settled, Roxie began looking around the pig stay of a house. Again, Bulma couldn't help but blush with embarrassment as her houseguest took in all the rancid smells and dirty surfaces. She was expecting the girl to be disgusted but, just like when she first saw Chi-Chi, she had a strange look of wonder on her face; like a child seeing Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory for the first time. Bulma's embarrassment soon turned to intrigue. Why wasn't she freaking out? Why wasn't she puking and running for the door? Was it possible that she liked what she saw?

"So, Roxie", said Bulma, "Thanks again for all the help. If you ever need anything in the future, don't be afraid to ask. Actually, let me make this trip worth your while. Would you care to join us for dinner?" Chi-Chi's ears perked up at the sound of dinner as she stupidly salivated on the floor by the couch.

"Sure. I'd love to stay for dinner", said Roxie with a pearly white smile.

"Great! Let me just whip something up real quick and I'll serve it right up", Bulma said as she made her way over to the countertop. She did this with all the mock exhaustion she could muster: stopping every few steps to catch her breath, wiping the imaginary sweat off her brow, straining to move one plump leg in front of the other; hoping that her peppy new friend would take notice. Luckily, all of Bulma's theatrics paid off.

"Aw, you poor thing. Don't stress yourself. You've worked so hard already. I'll take care of dinner. You just lay down and relax". After some mild protests, Bulma plopped down on the couch and kicked her feet up. The clever girl smiled with smug satisfaction, once again using her intellect to take advantage of Roxie's kindness.
.......................

Twenty minutes later, the food was all done. Roxie brought over three large pizzas and set them on the trash-covered coffee table in front of her heavy host. She also poured a large serving of the messy dog food into Chi-Chi's serving dish. Then she sat down next to Bulma, who already had two slices shoved into her mouth, and started watching the mindless images on the television screen. Roxie picked up a slice and neatly began to nibble on it. Sitting next to Bulma, the two provided a shocking contrast in lifestyles. Roxie's fit body and cleanly demeanor were far off from the slovenly Bulma, who's flabby body was bursting out of her soiled clothes. They couldn't be more different, Bulma thought. Then she couldn't help but snicker through her sauce-covered lip. Bulma had seen the same contrast when she first moved in to take care of Chi-Chi. How long would it take before Roxie was in her place. A shiver went down her spine when she realized she'd be ending up in Chi-Chi's place. She waved off her concerns just as quickly as she had them. She wasn't going to end up like Chi-Chi. She was too smart for that. She'd find a way to keep her from that horrible fate.

The blue-haired vixen then looked to her side and saw Roxie struggling to finish her second slice and a lightbulb went off. "Hey Roxie, you're not done already, are you?", asked the conniving Bulma. "What kind of host would I be if I let you leave with an empty stomach?"

"Well, I guess I can have a little more", Roxie replied.

"Oh, nonsense. I'd feel just awful if you ate anything less than that whole pie. You're still a growing young girl. You need to eat to keep your strength up."

Not wanting to be rude, Roxie picked up another slice, and another, and another, and another, until the entire pie was finished. The pink-haired girl was stuffed to the brim. She wasn't accustomed to eating that much in one sitting. She felt sick and bloated as she curled up on her side of the couch, cradling her turgid tummy in her grease-covered hands, belching every few seconds to alleviate the pressure within.

"Aw, you poor thing", Bulma said in a saccharine and patronizing tone. "Did you eat too much?" Roxie slowly nodded her head in response. "Oh, don't worry sweetie. Auntie Bulma will make it all better". Something about Bulma's voice was almost hypnotic to the overly full girl. There was a maternal edge to it that made Roxie feel safe. And this was only heightened when 'Auntie Bulma' pressed her warm, tender hands on her overstretched stomach and began to slowly rub it. Roxie's eyes rolled back in her head as she entered Cloud Nine, feeling a level of light-headed elation she'd never experienced before. "Don't worry about getting up my dear. Just relax and everything will be okay, I promise. In fact, you don't ever have to get up again".

As Roxie drifted off into oblivion, Bulma had a grin on her face that would make the Cheshire Cat jealous. Bulma knew she was lazy and couldn't control herself around food. But since exercise and dieting was such hard work, she'd just have to get someone else to eat her food for her. She may never be skinny again, but she was going to make sure she was the skinniest, neatest, and healthiest woman in the house; even if it was only in comparison to other obese slobs. Poor Roxie; she had no idea what she'd gotten herself into.

Misty had demanded that Ash stay in Viridian City with her until he was ready to go out and continue his Pokemon journey, but with her, in exchange for letting Pikachu live. Ash and Pikachu required an extended hospital visit after Misty bruised an battered them with her multi-ton body. It had not actually been the worst feeling in the world, being trapped underneath more overflowing softness than even a literal pile of blankets could provide, but it still cracked his rib cage and a broken left arm. Ash had not felt such terrible pain in his life before.

Misty, to everyone's surprised, was actually sorry for her actions, and apologized profusely. She claimed that she actually wasn't trying to hurt them at all, just rough them up a little, even going so far as to curse her own stomach for unintentionally causing harm to another trainer like this. It was clear however she was more sorry for hurting Ash then she was Pikachu, however. Ash and Pikachu stayed at one of the local Pokemon Centers, which had a small section in the back for human injuries, and he was watched over dutifully by the Nurse Joy present there.

She was still the same Misty, however, and when she came to visit, she didn't even bother to apologize for all the collateral damage she caused coming in, and Ash caught eyeing the Pokemon storage room with a hungry glare. Misty gave one look at Ash and Pikachu, and insisted that they were both well enough ti go back on their journey. However, Ash and Pikachu were still in a lot of pain, and although Misty was a very large, and I do mean LARGE women, they insisted they were not. And Ash wasn't rushing to get back on the road anytime soon now that she was going to be coming along with them. But ultimately, her intentions, while maybe a bit extreme, were still done with a desire to help rather than impede.

"Don't you think you started here long enough? It's already been an entire day!" Misty asked him. She crouched in a little closer over the bed. Her huge stomach rolled over on top of Ash's torso. Her belly was quite heavy and it felt even heavier than it did before. He could only assume that Misty, in her stressful state over Ash's condition, or had gotten bored of waiting, had tried to cool her nerves through lots of eating. Clearly it had done little more for her than make her fatter. Ash shuffled in his bed; he had a hard time breathing comfortably with so much of Misty's gut spread across his torso. It was not something he would have been able to pry off of himself with his own power, that was for sure.

"I mean...My arm is broken..." Ash tried to explain.

"Yeah, well you got another one. Come on, let's hit the road! How much longer is this going to take."

"Actually," Nurse Joy stepped into the room to greet the two of them, with some difficulty from how much of the room was occupied by Misty. "We had done some x-rays and it looks like your arm and chest is only sprained rather than outright broken. It'll be healing soon enough!"

"Oh, that's great!" Ash exclaimed. He was certainly relieved to hear that.

"Oh, Yes, It's a friggin miracle," Misty nodded, which caused her multiple chins to briefly jut out over her thick neck. "Which is all the more reason to get you off your lazy ass and keep your promise." Misty stared daggers at the boy.

"I don't know." Ash couldn't bring himself to look the red-haired blob in the eye as he told her this.

Misty's angry demeanor broke down all of the sudden and her bottom lip started to quiver. Then, after a quick sniffle, she pulled herself together and nodded her head. "I understand. I'm being a bit too forceful, aren't I? Ha ha ha! Well, take some time to think about it, okay? Let your arm heal up first, that's what is most important right now!"

Misty hoisted her massive blubber apron of a belly off of Ash's chest, and the young man found that he could fill his lungs more easily again.

"Misty?" Ash was, however, much more concerned about the woman that that belly was attached to.

"I'm going to go back to the buffet and see if they restocked it since last time. By Ash!" Misty called over her shoulder as she hurriedly waddled her way out of the room, taring down another wall with her rear end.

Ash sighed, slumping his head against his pillow. Nurse Joy giggled aloud.

"I guess that's young love for you, hmm?"

"What?"

"Well, she did hurt you, that means that she has a thing for you."

"How does spraining my chest and arm and beating up my Pokemon have anything to do with love?"

"I'm from cerulean City, where your lover is from. Over there, we follow a very strong condition called tough love. If what your saying is true, and all the damage she's done to make you hate her, proves that she is utterly infatuated with you."

Ash didn't really understand what was going on. He had known Misty for only a short while so far. She was a mean, rude, and greedy bitch who was trying to actually court him, while he was just a trainer starting his journey from humble beginnings. She had tortured his pikachu with her colossal boobs, butt-slammed them along with an unfortunate officer Jenny, and now was showing this less abrasive side. This had been a long time for interactions between random trainers on routes between cities, and maybe that butt slam could be considered a 'date' where she's from, and maybe he didn't think poorly of Misty's abundance of weight, but...no, now his mind was just running in circles the more he mulled it over.

Misty, meanwhile, was keeping herself preoccupied by stuffing her fat maw with food. Lots and lots of food. She didn't care what it was, along as it was edible. She was inside the local buffet who had indeed restocked there all you can eat section. She could feel the chocolate from a slice of cake starting to make her belly become very tight and full as it piled up inside her. She belched into her gravy-stained fist, using her other hand to take a swing at a pitcher of cola. It seemed no one would try and interfere with her feast. Well, she decided to herself, after she was done eating, she would clean up and go visit Ash again.

Against all odds and possible some laws of science, Pikachu started to take a liking to Misty, and her fluffy belly was often used as a makeshift pillow. The more they talked, the closer they grew. But there was a nagging concern that remained constantly present in the backs of their minds. Did they really like each other?

Both Ash and Misty had a lot to think about as the healing of the former's arm and chest progressed. It only took a few more days before Ash was deemed to be in a healthy enough state to leave the Pokemon Center. Of course, as soon as he stepped outside, he was immediately greeted by an anxious-looking Misty. She hastily scarfed down whatever chocolate treat she had been munching on at that moment and straightened her posture, shooting up a couple more feet in height. Ash sighed.

"What is it now, ya little shit?" Misty seemed especially annoyed, but Ash couldn't help but surmise that it was all because she was trying to hide her true feelings. It was plain as day on Misty's face that she was really trying to force out this projection of anger toward him. She was barely holding herself together as it was.

"I was thinking, The Kanto region is really huge and scary, but it might not be so scary if someone would come with me...for a while. With you, that is. I want to travel with you. I thought about it and I think it would be a really good option for me. You know, having someone there to protect you in case things get close. I mean, who knows what's out there?"

Ash still hade'nt forgiven her for beating Pikachu to near death, or hospitalizing him for a week, but he figured he had all the time in the world to try.

He still wasn't quite sure if he was ready for her to be ON TOP of him again after last time, but standing together like this in the midst of an embrace wasn't bad at all.

"Hey, you know what?"

"What is it?"

"I think I'm still gonna take your scrawny ass Pikachu of yours!"

"What?!"

"Don't worry, he'll still be yours in spirit, but I think It would be best if you gave me his pokeball. I am the real master in this relationship anyways!"

Ash's journey is certainly going to be an intresting one.

Her fear of bugs was Incredibly Irrational, however. Considering the facts that she is heavier, taller, and just plain stonger then most Pokemon in the world of Pokemon, she still was afraid of them.

Ash nodded. "Yeah. Nurse Joy said that this is the nearest route to Pewter City. So there's no way I'm skipping this, isn't that right Pikachu?" The ELetric mouse was slowly getting used to being in there, but the pressure still hurts like hell.

Her footprints alone created massive craters that completely obliterated the path behind the trio, tossing up raw dirt and earth.

However, the boy wouldn't budge. "I'm trying to become a Pokémon Master and to do that, I have to catch as many Pokémon as I can and Nurse Joy said that there's a lot of different kinds of them around in this forest!"

Misty paled as she thought. "Nurse Joy...why?"

Just then, a rustle was heard beside Misty. Well, It was really below misty she was so tall, but still the noise came from a bit of flora that she had not accidently destroyed. Yet. She hesitantly turned her head towards it, before she let out a loud scream when a Pokémon crawled out. But it wasn't just any Pokémon, it was a Bug type Pokémon. Misty ran over to Ash and tried to hide her massive and blobby body behind him "Ash! Look over there!"

Ash turned towards the direction that Misty was pointing at and smiled. "It's a Caterpie!" Ash quickly pulled out his Pokédex and pointed it towards the new Pokémon.

"Caterpie, the Worm Pokémon. Caterpie uses the suction cups on its feet to climb trees and feed on its favorite leaves."

Misty shivered in fear. "Even if that thing is a Pokémon, bugs are disgusting and I don't like them! Do something about it!"

"Alright then, stand back," Ash replied as Misty did as she was instructed, taking a step back into the forest, almost squsihing a stray Rattata, while Ash removed an empty Pokéball from his belt strap and turned his cap to the other side. "This one's a piece of cake." Caterpie stared at Ash with a confused look and tilted its head as Ash winded up his arm and tossed the Pokéball at it. "Pokéball go! Caterpie, you're mine!" The Pokéball bounced off Caterpie's head. It split opened and a red glow emitted from the Worm Pokémon's body as it screeched. Before long, the Pokémon's body had faded away into the glow and was reabsorbed back into the Pokéball before it closed.

The Pokéball landed on the ground and the button on it turned red as the Pokéball shook continuously for a few more times before the red light had vanish and the Pokéball stopped shaking, signaling a successful capture.

Ash's lips twitched for a moment. Then, he broke into a smile before he began to cheer aloud as he ran towards the Pokéball. "I did it!" Ash stopped in front of the Pokéball and lowered himself as he picked it up. "I did it! I caught Caterpie! I did it all by myself! I caught my first Pokémon! This is the first step of my way to becoming the number one Pokémon Master in the whole world."

Misty grabbed Ash with a meaty hand and plunged him into the air, stopping his stupor to find a particulary Irrate Misty. "Ash, quit it. Your acting like a little..."

"Look!" Ash interrupted as he shoved the Pokéball in her face. "Inside this Pokéball is the first Pokémon I've ever caught in my whole entire life!"

"Great," Misty dropped Ash onto her massive pair of breasts, almost losing him inside her valley of cleavage. "Just keep it away from me, will ya?"

Ash smirked. "You're not afraid of a little Caterpie in a Pokéball, are you?"

"Bugs get me all bugged out!" Misty cried. "Even when they're in a Pokéball. Just keep it away!"

"I like bugs even if they aren't in Pokéballs," Ash replied. "It must be great for Caterpie inside the Pokéball. All cute and comfortable inside there. I love my new little Pokémon."

Misty rolled her eyes in annoyance. "I guess it takes a worm to love a worm." She flicked ash off her monumental rack nto the ground with a thud.

"Very funny," Ash said with mock amusement, dusting himself off.

Then, Ash approached his loyal freind Pikachu. "Pikachu, inside this Pokéball is our new friend!" Pikachu leaned forward and sniffed the Pokéball before grinning. Ash smiled. "I'm glad you like it. And from now on, we'll catch a whole bunch of new friends!" Ash lowered his eyes to meet the Pokéball containing Caterpie and said. "Caterpie, you're sticking with us."

Another shiver went down Misty's flabby back as she slowly turned her massive body around "Wait...does that mean..."

"Caterpie, come on out!" Ash cried as the Pokéball splits open, releasing Caterpie from the Pokéball in the form of a white glow. At that moment, Misty turn tailed and made her quick escape to...well, you that sea of trees that Trainers arent allowed to go in because their so dence their inaccesible and protected by the government because their ecologically sensitive?

That's where she hid.

Ash sighed as he approached Caterpie. "There's nothing to be scared of, Misty." He turned back to Caterpie and stretched out his hand to the Worm Pokémon. "Come on, Caterpie. Climb up on my shoulder." Caterpie nodded as it crawled towards Ash's hand. Then, it stopped the moment it caught sight of Misty. Before any of them could react, Caterpie was already making its way towards Misty. She was a quarter a mile away but that didnt stop it.

"Hey! Caterpie, come back!"

Misty screamed as Caterpie rubbed itself against her leg. She was shivering out of fear as Caterpie let out a purr-like squeal while it continued rubbing itself on the smooth, soft, blobby flesh of her leg.

Ash smiled. "Hey Misty! Caterpie really likes you. Isn't that cute?"

Misty fell to her knees, almost crushing Caterpie and shrieked. "Get this disgusting bug away from me!" Caterpie froze and tilted its head on confusion as Misty backed away from it. "Please, don't get any closer to me!"

"What?" Ash asked. "You don't like Caterpie? And you think Caterpie's disgusting?"

Caterpie's eyes widened when those words hits it. Caterpie lowered its head, saddened by what it had heard. Pikachu approached it and he placed a paw on its back, comforting it before Misty grabbed him.

"I know!" Misty said. "You be friends with that creepy bug and I'll be friends with Pikachu."

Ash scoffed. "Pikachu only likes me and zaps anybody who tries to...huh?"

Unexpectedly, Pikachu was enjoying Misty's hand as she gently rubbed his head. Ash grumbled as his fingers twitched uncontrollably. "Pikachu..."

Misty paused and looked down, only to see that Caterpie was near her again with saddened eyes. Misty cringed. "It's so gross! Ash, put that slimy thing back in the Pokéball. Bugs are one of the three most disgusting things in the world!"

"Aside from you, what are the other two disgusting things?" Ash asked, clearly annoyed with Misty's attitude towards Caterpie.

Misty huffed. "Carrots, peppers and bugs. Everybody has something they don't like and I don't like bugs!"

Misty turned away, giving him a rather lwed view of her naked rear end, and Ash sighed as he knelt down to meet Caterpie's eyes. "I don't think you're disgusting or ugly at all, Caterpie. Come on, climb up on my shoulder." Caterpie hesitated for a moment as Ash's hand neared it. Caterpie turned to Pikachu, who gave it a nod. Ash smiled. "You're not going to scare Misty anymore." Caterpie let out a small screech as it began crawling up Ash's arm and it stopped on his shoulder, believing in Ash's words.

"What do you mean it won't scare me?" Misty asked.

Ash smirked. "We're going on without her. Come on, Pikachu." The Mouse Pokémon nodded as he hopped out of Misty's hands and followed Ash.

Misty groaned. "I'll show you!"
113132222112211112.title: Behind her rude facade was a gentle heart

choices: Ash and Misty spends the night at the Pokemon Center
The signature 'P' up close wasent a P at all!
1131322221122111122.content:
For Ash, walking besides Misty was an Interesting position to be in, certainly, a position that he was still quite dazed about. Even though he had known Misty for a while know, his mind was spinning, confusion and awe mixing, with a dash of alarm; there was no lack of lethality on Misty.

Strolling with Pikachu on his left shoulder and caterpie on his right, he tried to keep up with Misty's gargantuan and blobby form as she carved out a new route through the Veridian forest. Panicked flocks of Bird Pokemon flew out of the violenly shaking trees, just before they were parted as an enormous, fully-exposed belly wobbled into view, breaking branches like a bulldozer of fat, and propelled by a pair of humongous, fat thighs.

"Jeeze, Misty..." Ash said unsurely, "You sure know how to find a new path!"

"It is sooooooo hot!" Misty whined, ignoring Ash's praise, so gigantic that she towered over the trees that only reached her overfed belly and forest-clearing hips. Her immense shadow blocked out the sun for the Pokemon trainer and his Pokemon (and mostly everything) below, and they looked up, literally unable to see Misty's face past her huge belly and even more enormous boobs. The massive eighteen-year-old was clad in nothing. Absolutely nothing. Her massive mamarries and Mamoswine sized booty were so large, no piece of clothing on the planet could contain them. Giving Ash, six years younger then Misty, a rather...Interesting sight.

"Uh oh. Pikachu, Caterpie! Run! She's sitting down!" gasped Ash, as the shadow over them grew. He and his Pokemon dashed quickly away to make room for the enormous teenager.

Misty's titanic booty hit the forest floor with an earth-shaking crash, crushing several more trees under its mass and causing more wild Pokemon to flee from its enormity.

"Good Arceus, Misty! Does the word 'Diet' give you an allergic reaction or something?" panted Ash, as he, Pikachu and Caterpie emerged from the leaf-litter and gazed up at the humongous girl sitting before them.

"I'm staaaaarving" declared Misty, ignoring Ash once again, soaked in sweat with her head and shoulder still exposed to the sun's rays. Ash may not have approved of Misty's method of trailblazing, but at least her her monstrous bosom, which, with her sitting, were level with most of the trees around, kept them comfortable In the shade they cast. Indeed, many of the branches of nearby trees had cracked, her giant boobs having collided with, or simply poured over and overburdened them.

Licking her lips, she looked down at the many tree branches that were buckling and snapping around her immense, overflowing bosom. She easily broke off a branch full of apple-sized fruits. Raising the branch above her head, she proceeded to shake the fattening fruits into her gaping maw, causing her huge, fat arm and gigantic chest to wobble and shake blubberily. She then devoured the entire branch itself, wood and leaves and all.

"I just LOOOVE nature" cooed the gluttonous girl through a mouthful of food, juice trickling out her stuffed cheeks and down her double-chin. She ran a chubby finger over her vast cleavage, gathering up some juice that had fallen.

"Where would I be without you guys?" she grinned, using her other hand to heave aside one monstrous breast (snapping a few more tree branches in the process) so she could actually see her boyfriend and his two Pokemon standing next to one of her giant thighs.It had been Ash with backing from Pikachu and Caterpie after all, who suggested Misty to find a fater route out of the forest. None of them thought that she would just bulldoze right through it, though.

"Probably a whole lot thinner..." whispered Ash to Pikachu, as they both smiled nervously up at the gigantic teen, who was now reaching a wobbling arm out and tearing off another branch. She reminded Ash of a huge, grazing animal. Like a Miltank, or a Turous...but even fatter.

"Gosh Misty, your like some kind of non-stop eating doomsday machine!" Ash hollered up at her so she could hear him.

Ash looked up, watching those gigantic boobs wobble and jiggle heavily with even the slightest of Misty's motions, tree branches snapping against their immense weight. The jiggling rippled down to her massive, fat belly which they sat upon hugely.

"Oh, cut me some slack....I'm just a growing teenager..." Misty replied with a cheeky grin.

Ash sighed. he was beginning to think with the rate that there were going with Misty's snack breaks, that they probably should have just stuck with the default path. Oh well. Ash wasn't in THAT much of a hurry. Although, It would be nice to have his schedule not be based around his girlfriend's eating habits.

Realizing they were going nowhere until Misty has had her fill, they all decided to take a short "snack break", in the huge clearing Misty had so conveniently created. "Well, there's another thing she does well." Ash stated to his Pokemon. "She sure makes a pretty good tent" he commented, as he and his two Pokemon sat on one of Misty's enormous, fully-exposed thighs. Ash made sure that she wouldn't notice that Caterpie was there, knowing her fear of bugs.

Pikachu was sitting with his back against Misty's huge belly as it poured onto her fat thighs. He was sinking quite a bit into her soft, warm, (and rather sweaty) gut.

"Pika Piii~" he agreed. Looking up, Misty's monstrous boobs created more than enough shade for all of them, still wobbling and jiggling as they heard Misty piggishly stuffing her face. Occasionally crumbs would rain down.

They didn't take long to set off on the road again, or, for Misty to start making a road again. The forest slowly thinned out to a level grassy plain with a definite dirt path and some rocks and ledges here and there. It was a very peaceful, picturesque scene. However, there was little time for Ash and his Pokemon to enjoy It as Misty's heavy feet plowed through the landscape, crushing grass and upturning rocks. The only thing that really bothered Misty about it was the occasional Rattata screaming as it narrowly escapes her gait. Misty looked up at the sky and enjoyed the peaceful sunny sky...why was that cloud moving so fast?

"Oh no..." Ash said as she stared upwards. "I guess we'll be seeing rain soon. If the clouds are drifting that fast, that means rain and fog in no time."

"What?! Wait, can't we set up a camp or something?" Misty queried. Any camping trip or Pokemon journey could have the joy snuffed out of it in a flash by the whims of mother nature it seemed.

"Hey, whats that over there?" Ash said pointing his index figure in the direction of a building in the distance. Misty could scarcely make out the signature 'P' of the Pokemon Center. "There's a Pokemon Center just up the road. If we hurry, we can be there before the rain starts falling too hard." with that Misty pelted off ahead, admittedly keeping an impressive pace in and of itself, while Ash, Pikachu and Caterpie struggled to keep up behind her.
1131322221122111122.title: Misty clears a path through the forest with her...

choices: Ash turned his attention back to Pikachu.
11313222211221111222.content:
As Misty, Ash and his two Pokémon walked along the path down to the Pokemon Center, they soon came to the horrid realization that what they were walking to was not, at all, a Pokemon Center. The signature 'P' that is proudly displayed over Pokemon Centers was actually the faded and dilapidated neon sign of "Paul's Diner", an abandoned eatery that went out of business.

"Are you kidding me, right now!?" Misty screamed at the top of her lungs. "What the hell are we gonna do now?!"

"Gee, Misty..." Ash deadpanned. "Maybe we can camp out in the wilderness like all the other Pokemon Trainers do."

"Phhhtt" Misty scoffed, but quickly came to the conclusion that there was no other option then what Ash proposed. Reluctantly, she agreed.

Night soon came and a camp fire was quickly set up by Ash as he and his Pokémon and Misty gathered around a small tree trunk which had its top cut down. Well, cut down is a very vague word. It was more like Misty leaned up against it and it broke, nearly crushing Ash in the process. "Sleep well, guys."

"Well, I can't sleep with all the noise you're making!" Misty cried from the opposite side of the tree trunk. "And make sure that you keep that disgusting bug away from me!"

The 10 year old boy scoffed as he turned away. "Don't listen to her, Caterpie."

Minutes later, the two humans had fallen asleep. Caterpie sighed as it crawled down the tree trunk and towards one of the surrounding trees. Pikachu noticed this and followed the Worm Pokémon. As Pikachu approached Caterpie, he asked. "Is something wrong, Caterpie?"

"Pikachu," Caterpie answered. "Do you think Misty will treat me differently if I was a little...different?"

The Mouse Pokémon tilted his head at Caterpie and scratched his ear. "How different are you talking about?"

Caterpie turned towards the sky. "Just look at the sky, Pikachu. The moon is bright and beautiful tonight, isn't it?"

"Yeah, I guess it is," Pikachu nodded. "But how does that make a difference to you?"

Just then, the two spotted a new Pokémon flying by. The Pokémon resembles a vaguely anthropomorphic butterfly with a purple body. It only had two body segments and four light blue legs. It had two black antennae, a light blue snout with two fangs underneath, and large, red compound eyes. Its two pairs of veined wings are white with black accents.

"It's a Butterfree!" Pikachu cried.

Caterpie nodded. "Yes. And that is my final Evolution stage as well."

"So are you planning to become a Butterfree so that you can change Misty's mind about you?" Pikachu asked.

The Worm Pokémon nodded again. "In my current stage, I'm nothing more than a weak Pokémon. But if I were to become a Butterfree, I'm sure I can become stronger. And humans also think that Butterfree are more 'cuter'. So I can benefit both Ash and Misty. It's killing two birds with one stone!"

Pikachu sighed. "I'm sure the part where you become stronger isn't just based on Evolution, Caterpie. It's based on the effort you put into and the training you have to become stronger. But I do have to agree with you on the 'cuter' part. Misty will surely change her mind about you if you evolve into a Butterfree!"

A smile grew on Caterpie's face. "I'm glad you're with me, Pikachu."

The next morning:

Misty blinked as she stirred the moment she woke up. She yawned and turned. “I’m still sleepy…” groaned the spoiled, overgrown baby, her slightly chubbier face scrunching up and her fattening double chin becoming more obvious as it did. But immediately froze when she spotted a small figure sleeping on to her. Misty's body shook in fear as her eyes locked onto the figure in front of her, which she knew as Ash's Caterpie. Without hesitation, Misty let out an extremely loud scream.

Both Ash and Pikachu as well as Caterpie woke up in shock as Ash got up, still in his sleeping bag, and hopped towards Misty while he looked around with concern. "What? What's wrong? W-what's happening?"

"What is this thing doing sleeping near me?!" Misty demanded, pointing at Caterpie, residing on her left breast.

Ash paused as he now realized what the problem was and laughed. "Caterpie just wants to be your friend!"

Misty screamed. "If that thing wants to be my friend, it can stop bugging me already!" Without hesitation, and with almost Impossible speed for someone of her girth, got up off of her back and stood off, making caterpie lose his footing and fall to the ground, busing him.

She placed her hands on her hips and glared down at the poor Worm Pokémon. "If you're a Pokémon, get out of my face and into the Pokéball!" Hearing this, Caterpie froze as he felt pain filling up his heart from Misty's rejection to accept him as her friend. With his head down, Caterpie turned and crawled away towards his Pokéball.

Seeing this, Ash glared at the girl. "Misty, you are so unbelievable! Caterpie means no harm! Why it likes you I'll never know." Ash turns back to Caterpie and he falls down on his front, crawling beside Caterpie. "Caterpie, are you alright?" The Worm Pokémon ignored his Trainer's concerned question and taps his Pokéball, which split opened and Caterpie was reabsorbed into it in the form of a red glow. Ash got up and removed his sleeping bag before turning back to Misty and spoke. "Alright, Misty, you owe Caterpie an apology. Pokémon have feelings too, you know."

Misty turns away, folding her arms as she scoffed at Ash.

Ash lowered himself down and picked up Caterpie's Pokéball. "Come on, Caterpie. You don't have to worry. Someday, we'll show her!"

Then, the sound of wings flapping caught all of their attention as a Pokémon flew by Pikachu and landing next to a patch of grass. The Pokémon was a raptor-like avian Pokémon. It was covered with brown feathers, and had a cream-colored face and underside. It had a crest of pinkish-red feathers on its head and black, angular markings behind its eyes. The plumage of its tail had alternating red and yellow feathers with ragged tips. Its beak and legs were pink, and it had powerful, sharp talons.

Ash quickly picks up his hat and his Pokédex as he points the device at the Pokémon. "It's a Pidgeotto!"

"Pidgeotto, an evolved form of the Pidgey. It is armed with sharp claws and dives from the sky to capture its prey. Unlike the more gentle Pidgey, Pidgeotto can be dangerous. Approach with extreme caution."

Suddenly, memories of Ash's first encounter with Misty resurfaced. How she ate all those poor, innocent Pokemon. Sure, they were trying to kill him so they were not that Innocent, but still, she ATE them! That gave Ash the resolve to make sure he catches this Pokemon before Misty can do anything to harm it.

Smiling, Ash puts his Pokédex away and pulls out a Pokéball. "Alright, Pidgeotto. I'll show you who's the dangerous one around here." Without any thoughts, Ash tossed the Pokéball at it, which Pidgeotto swats away with its wing.

The Pokéball fell back and rolled towards Ash as he stood there dumbfounded. Misty rolled her eyes and sighed. "You don't get it, do you? I might have a special exception for your Pokemon because your my boyfreind, but Pokemon are food, noting more. Besides, You don't just throw a Pokéball and capture a Pokémon. You have to make it battle and weaken it first! The only reason you got to catch Caterpie is because it's already a weakling!"

"Give me a break," Ash retorted. "I just started two days ago! And quit picking on Caterpie! Now if you'd kindly keep your big mouth shut so you don't eat it this time, you'll see how it's done!" Ash turned his head back to the occupied Pidgeotto and gritted his teeth as one thought ran through his mind. "How will I do this? Caterpie's a Bug Pokémon and Pidgeotto is a Flying Pokémon. Bug types are weak against Flying type so I'm at a disadvantage." Just then, a realization hit him and he turned to Pikachu.

"Pikachu, you're up!" Ash cried.

The Mouse Pokémon nodded as he made his way over towards Ash. "Alright, Pikachu! Your Electric attacks will work well against Pidgeotto! So use Thunder Shock!" Pikachu grinned as sparks crackled along his cheeks before he discharged them at the Bird Pokémon, who had just turned at that moment and flew up into the air to avoid the attack.

As the attack zapped the ground, Ash gritted his teeth. "Look out, Pikachu. Here it comes!" Pikachu stood firmly on his feet as the Pidgeotto turned, diving down towards the Mouse Pokémon. Pidgeotto swooped in, folding its wings back to gain more momentum as it did. Pikachu anticipated this thanks to Ash's warning and he leapt over the Bird Pokémon.

Misty stared down at the scene, clearly impressed by Pikachu's movements and maybe even Ash's skills as she muttered to herself. "He may look like a twit, but he's actually a good Trainer. And Pikachu...who knew a Pikachu could move that fast?"

Pidgeotto swirled as it flew back towards the sky. It's eyes glared intensively at the Mouse Pokémon as it dove down once more. This time, a white glow formed along its body, leaving a white trail behind as it continued diving down towards Pikachu.

"What's that?!" Ash asked, stunned by the new attack he had never seen before.

Misty sighed. "That's Quick Attack, you idiot. It's the most basic of attacks you can think of. And to think I was even changing my thoughts of you..."
11313222211221111222.title: The signature 'P' up close wasent a P a...

113132222112211112221.content:
"Alright, Pikachu! Dodge it again!" The Mouse Pokémon nodded his head as he leapt once more, landing on Pidgeotto's head and hopping off the second he had landed. Pidgeotto crashed onto the ground and skidded to a halt as its beak became stuck under the ground. Pidgeotto's eyes widened in surprise when it realized this and quickly struggled to pull its beak out but the strength it needed had already been used up diving down constantly.

Smiling, Ash cried. "Pikachu, Thunder Shock!" The Pokémon complied as sparks of electricity crackled again on his cheeks. Pikachu raised his paws up and arced them as he fell onto all four once more, releasing his electric attack on the Bird Pokémon.

This time, Pidgeotto couldn't dodge the attack and it ended up taking the effective attack head on. It squawked in pain but its voice couldn't be heard as its beak was still stuck to the ground. The next thing it knew, the attack stopped and Pidgeotto collapsed, falling onto its two legs.

Ash grabbed one of his empty Pokéball and grinned as he winded up his arm. "Pokéball, go!" He tossed the Pokéball.

As it hurled towards the unconscious Pokéball, the two humans and Pikachu waited anxiously as the Pokéball struck Pidgeotto's head. The Pokéball split opened, engulfing Pidgeotto in a red glow which absorbed the Bird Pokémon back into the capsule. The Pokéball closed as it fell onto the ground. The button on the Pokéball blinked red from seconds to seconds as it shook for a few times. But then...it stopped.

Seeing this, Ash froze for a moment. His lips twitched momentarily before breaking out into a grin as he threw his arms into the air. "We did it!"

"Pikachu!" Cried the Mouse Pokémon, doing a small victory pose.

Ash picked up Pidgeotto's Pokéball, smirking as he turned to face Misty. He walked up to her and spoke. "Well? What do you think? Aren't I the greatest?"

Misty scoffed. "At least you have some knowledge of Pokémon Battles. Here I was thinking that you wanted to prove that Caterpie isn't weak by sending it out. If you had done that, I would have said that you are the worst Pokémon Trainer in the whole world. After all, the Pokémon Trainer's judgement is more important than anything else. Luckily for you, at least you have a brain that has that judgement."

Glaring at her, Ash spoke. "Well, I didn't mess it up. But I'll make sure Caterpie proves that it isn't weak and you can bet on it!"

Later...

Ironically, the one person that has been trying to impress his girlfriend at how good of a Pokemon trainer he is, Is also the one person who wanted to get away from her the most.

Ash and Misty were, techically, In as relationship, but lately Ash has been questioning weather It was Incredibly one sided or not. He wasn't too fond of the teenager's penchant for over-indulgence, attention-grabbing, and vanity. He also thought Misty should really do something about coveing herself up, instead of parading those giant udders and fat ass of hers.

Ash and his Pokemon *Except Pidgeotto because he wanted to meet him later) strayed from the gluttonous bvlob that was misty as she took another snack break. , seeking some peace and quiet.

"Ahhh, it sure is nice having all this room out here" smiled Ash to himslef, looking around at the peaceful surroundings as he heard the noise and activity of his fellow-trainer girlfreind nearby.

He, Pikachu and Caterpie were basking in the beautiful scene set before them: a placid pond, surrounded by water vegetation, flowery bushes, and trees as Insect Pokemon flitted about.

"It sure is a whole lot easier to contemplate nature without someone's giant boobs pinning you to the ground" he added with a roll of her eyes, picturing his predicament when he was forced to sleep next to the tree stump he shared with Misty. "Shared" was a generous word. As, he was smothered and nearly crushed to death when Misty rolled over In her sleep, almost killing Ash and his Pokemon in the process.

"I wonder where that fat blob has-" he began, but he was interrupted by a tremor.

"Spoke too soon" he said glumly, just as he heard the sound of splitting wound as the trees behind him collapsed. So much for peace and quiet.

"Ashhhh, babeeeee" boomed Misty's voice from above, the entire forest shaking as the monstrously-fat girl took an earth-shaking step forward, causing her massive thighs to wobble blubberily. Although he couldn't SEE Misty's face from where he sat thanks to the red head's giant belly and boobs, he knew his enormous girlfreind was eating. She sounded like her mouth was full, and she could her the girl munching in between words.

Misty had just come from the short "snack break" she had decided to take earlier, and went out for a little walk, presumably to look for even MORE food, after cleaning out their entire camp site (she only took a few giant steps from where they had set-up camp, anyway).

"Hi Mist" said Ash in response, looking up and seeing Misty's giant belly looking even fatter and more bloated than usual. Looks like she had eaten quite a bit during the snack break. 'Great, just what I need. My massive Girlfreind fattening-up my picture' he thought, as Misty's massive shadow loomed over the scene he and his beloved Pokemon were watching. Several of the birds and small Pokemon that had gathered around the pond took one look at the behemoth beauty and took flight.

"Just finished my little snack break" said Misty, licking her pudgy fingers as she tried to see her boyfriend past her monumental bosom. "I can't believe we ran out of food so fast" went Misty with a roll of her eyes.

"Oh my ARCEUS, is that a pond? Good timing, I'm thirsty!" went Misty hungrily, spying the small pond beyond the horizon of her monstrous cleavage.

"No Misty, don't-!" began Ash, as the immense shadow of Misty's figure seemed to grow over him. But it was too late.

Ash and the others had no choice but to spring aside, as the massively obese teen got down on her hands and knees.

The entire forest shook with the impact, every exposed foot of Mistys flesh wobbling with fat. Her gigantic breasts crashed onto the ground, knocking over trees, flattening shrubs and bushes, and crushing poor Pikachu who didn't get out of the way In time. Her giant ass knocked-over and crushed several trees that were still standing behind her.

"Too....much...boob...." groaned Ash, who was painfully getting up from the forest floor. He had darted away just enough, it seemed, as the one of Misty's overflowing breasts was bulging just a foot or two from where he lay. Caterpie was unscathed, but where was Pikachu?

'What a fat blob' thought Ash, staring at the immensity of Misty and watching his girlfriend greedily slurp up the entire pool of of water that he had been contemplating peacefully just seconds ago. To Ash, she looked like a massive Pokemon drinking from a watering hole...probably like an Snorlax...but even FATTER.

As Misty happily chugged, Ash walked around his girlfriend's gargantuan body and observed. Even on all fours, Misty's boobs were so massive they pressed against the ground with boobage to spare. Her belly was not far behind, also pressing into the ground and forming thick rolls of fat.

"That is one BIG butt..." said Ash softly, coming around to Misty's immense booty, which seemed to perfectly balance her monstrous breasts in terms of size and mass. Trees were bent and broken under those gargantuan ass cheeks, and he could HEAR them groaning under the Immense pressure.

Misty shifted her position (probably to get to the pond she was slurping up easier), getting down onto her elbows (which Ash was positive now made Misty's chin sink deep into her own mountainous cleavage). The movement seemed to cause the entire forest to shake, making Misty's giant booty to wobble heavily, along with those monstrous thighs that held them up.

"That is one REALLY big butt..." gulped Ash, wondering how much fatter his girlfreind could get.

Misty chugged...and chugged...and chugged...until soon the entire pond was bone-dry.

Misty let out a massive belch that shook the forest. She was sitting in the clearing, trees crushed under her fat ass, with water from the pond smeared on her chubby cheeks, double chin, and even dripping down her gigantic cleavage.

"OhArceus that was-BURRRRRPPPPP-soooooo good! I really needed that drink. And I lve the taste of water type Pokemon!" she said happily, licking her pudgy fingers and lips clean as she rubbed her now even fatter gut. Her fat arm wobbled as she did, and inevitably pushed against her monstrous, swollen breasts that spilled heavily over her giant belly.

Ash, meanwhile, was sitting in between Misty's tremendous thighs and looking up at his engorged, overgrown girlfriend. He had changed the subject of his peaceful pond, and he was now looking a massively fat teenage red head.

"Pika!" Pikachu went as he was fished out from in between Misty breasts. After getting squished by them he somehow managed to worm his body in between the two masses, like two Wailords converging onto a toothpick. Misty nly noticed him as the last moment, opening her yes to reveal it was Ash's Pikachu, or rather HER Pikachu, and not a stray water Pokemon trying to escape.

"Woops! Sorry Pikachu," Misty went casually as she flicked the poor rodent Pokemon back to the earth near Ash's feet.

Just then...
113132222112211112221.title: Ash turned his attention back to Pikachu.

choices: Caterpie comes out of his Pikeball
Mewtwo watches Misty destroy his home, and he is not happy
1131322221122111122212.content:
Ash and misty crossed the fifth sign now that was forebodingly adorned with skulls and crossbones behind big bold red letter that read “Enter at your own risk”. They had picked up the trail again and were on their way to Pewter City, when it had appeared that that had entered a rather dangerous part of the forest according to all the threatening sights.

"Until they start putting up some real skulls", Spoke Misty aloud, "they were kidding themselves if they thought they would fool anyone with that nonsense." Effortlessly, she trampled the sign into dust with a fat toe, almost crushing Ash in the process.

Moonlight blanketed the forest so calmly as Ash and Misty walked through the forest. Armed with his trusty team of Pokémon, along with a larger then life girlfriend, Ash was confident as he and Misty skipped across a river and entered the so called “Unknown Dungeon”: Ash pointed out to Misty that it was a shortcut, that it would take them straight to the city in no time at all. In all of his excitement he forgot that Misty was most likely not going to fit inside.

But he didn't realize, and Misty didn't care as she knew what the cave's history was. It was rumored to have be the den on an unimaginably strong Pokémon. Few to that day even believed it still was alive, let alone if it still resided in that boring cave. Any who have scoured the cave for any length of the time either returned empty-handed or didn’t return at all.

Until Misty came along, that is.

Soon enough, they arrived at the entrance of the cave. It was then that Ash finally put two and two together and saw that the roof of the tunnel entrance only came to Misty's big behind: She towered over the cave and fasted a shadow in the moonlight over the mountain that housed it.

"Uhhh...Misty?" Ash said, feeling rather stupid. "Maybe this Essentex such a good idea..."

But to Misty, hearing those words come from Ash''s mouth only gave her more motivation to make the journey and brave the darkness in search of one of the most powerful Pokémon in the world:

Mewtwo.

"Don't worry Ash. Just go on in and I'll be right behind ya~." Misty chirped cheerily. Ash was hesitant, but he obeyed her anyways. It was neve a good idea to go against Misty. He stepped into the cave and walked in.

Misty smiled and lied down on the ground, shaking the earth and smashing a few stray trees in the process, her gigantic posterior jiggling in the air for all the world to seeAsh and Pikachu expertly dodged a piece of rock falling from the roof of the cave dislodged by the tremors, prompting Ash to grow concerned. Misty scooted her body into the cave, plunging the entrance with her neck flab alone as the Goliath squeezed herself in.

"M-m-Misty!" Ash yelled, suddenly getting a pretty good idea of the events to come. "Why don't we find another way to Pewter City? The walk is it t-that long!" But Misty ignored her boyfriends ramblings and wiggled her body a couple moor inches forward, her shoulders taking part of the mountain side with her. Inch by inch, more pliable blubber oozed its way into the relatively diminutive hole in the side of the mountain.

Ash could do nothing as his world was slowly overtaken with soft, pale flab; and realized that the most logical solution to not getting crushed into oblivion was to stay ahead of Misty's advance. Reluctantly, he started to walk forward, with no way of turning back as Misty was a mere two feet behind him.

But the adventure started off slow without hide nor hair of any legends. Sure, the odd Zubat or Graveler encounter kept Ash on his toes and Misty well fed, but otherwise it was a snore.
1131322221122111122212.title: Caterpie tries to make freinds with Misty again

11313222211222.content:
Ash burst into the double glass doors of the Poke Center like a Zubat (Get it?) out of the distortion world. He was still riding the decrepit bike, and skidded across the floor landing at the counter.

"Young man!" The nurse Joy from behind the counter scolded, "This is not the place to be ridin--OH MY ARCEUS WHAT HAPPENED TO THAT PIKACHU!" Joy screamed as she eyed the severely battered and bruised electric mouse in Ash's arms.

Ash shoved Pikachu into Joy's arms, careful not to hurt him anymore then he already was. "Please help us!" Ash shouted, "Me and Pikachu got into a fight with this really fat lady with red hair, and he needs help now!"

"That's where you're wrong Twilight. I've still got a few tricks up my sleeve", he said as he pulled up the fur on his arm and shot out a deck of playing cards."I've always got an angle. Go ahead, turn me back to stone.You'll set me free eventually."

"I don't know what you're talking about, but we'll never let you go!", shouted Rainbow Dash. "Have fun being a statue for the rest of your life!"

And with that, the six ponies shot the demon with their elements, but before Discord was trapped, a thick green gas shot out from around him and consumed the young girls. Twilight's quick thinking allowed he to put up an energy field around herself before it hit her, but he strong gust of thick wind knocked the others off their hooves and left them coughing and gagging with their eyes watering.

"What in tarnation was that", said Applejack in her typical country manner.

"I don't know, but whatever it was, I can't be good", said Twilight before her stomach started to grumble.
"Yeah, it was really weird. I don't know why, but I'm starving", said Pinkie Pie.

"You're always starving Pinkie, but now that you mention it, I'm pretty hungry too", responded Rainbow Dash.
"How about we head over to the farm and grab something to eat? Grannie Smith was coming up a big batch of apple fritters before we left. I'm sure their done by now".

"Great idea Applejack. You should all try and keep your strength up while I go back to the library to do some research".

Are you sure you're not hungry darling", asked Rarity, " because all this fighting has left me absolutely famished".

"No, I'm fine. I'll catch up to you girls later. I have a really bad feeling about that gas"

Immediately, without question or second thought, the entire group dug in more savagely than usual. They weren't even using their hooves anymore-- Just eating like animals. Rarity, who was the most sophisticated, even blanked out, reduced to digging her head into her pie and making a mess. Fluttershy, who normally took small bites or nibbles, was taking massive bites. Rainbow Dash and Applejack were eating so much, destroying their athletic bodies without noticing. The mares didn't seem to have anything but food on their minds, as if they were possessed somehow.

Their eating was making them pack more pounds than normal. By some weird magic, after 10 minutes of devouring everything on the table, the mares' plots were filling up their seats. Their bellies were growing into pudgy potbellies. Their arms, legs, and cheeks were becoming lardy, with a double chin forming too. Somehow, within this time, they were already growing pudgy. The growing gals even feasted on things that weren't on the table. After the food on the table was finished, they were even filling up on anything edible in the fridge and cabinets, turning everything into a mess!

Applejack, Rainbow Dash, Pinkie Pie, Rarity, and Fluttershy had destroyed the kitchen in their food rush. They were only lucky Big Mac, Applebloom, and Granny Smith were out handling errands together. After eating everything in the house...

Twilight and Spike made their way through town on their way to the train station when they noticed something odd about the mares in Ponyville. Every one of them seemed to be eating something.

"That's strange. I've never seen such a long line at Sugar Cube Corner before", said the princess. The line was out the door and down the block. The girls with food had bloated middles and the ones in line looked like they were dying of starvation. Twilight saw poor Lyra all curled up, holding her belly in pain. Twilight wanted to get her something to eat, but there must've been thirty ponies on that line with the same look of hunger. She couldn't possibly feed all of them.

As the two made there way inside, they were greeted by an even stranger sight. Mr. Cake was behind the counter serving up bowls of cake mix and frosting to unruly customers. Said customers were shoving their greedy faces in and drinking it all up. Burps could be heard throughout the bakery as the walls vibrated ever so slightly. Twilight walked up to the counter while stepping over the bloated, gassy Mayor Mare who was sprawled out on the floor. "Hey Mr. Cake", she said while still surveying the room. She looked down at the bowl of cake batter and asked, "Do you guys have some kind of promotion going on".

"No, but I'm glad your here Twilight", said Mr. Cake. He looked exhausted. "You've gotta help me. These dames have gone crazy! Here I was, minding my own business, when all these ponies come rushing in. At first, I thought it was just a big lunch crowd, but then they kept coming. All of them! First they bought all the cakes, then the cookies, then the candy. I couldn't keep up. My wife's been no help either. She's gorging too! I couldn't make the food fast enough, so I just started serving them frosting and chocolate chips. I don't know what to do. If this continues, I'll be all out of food. I'll have to start cooking the cake pans! The cake pans!".

"Wait, they all came her at once? What time was it exactly?", asked the inquisitive alicorn.

"Around 2:30. Why?", asked Cake.

"That's right after we had our battle with Discord. Spike, I think I know what's happening!", Twilight shouted to her assistant who was trying to sneak some frosting off a passed out pony's face. "The gas Discord released must be affecting these pony's hunger. Oh no. I didn't even think about it spreading throughout the town. Who knows how far it reached. Spike, we need to get to Canterlot as soon as possible. I don't know why he would do this, but I'm sure it's not good."

"Alright, an adventure! This is going to be awesome! Save me some gemstones Mr. Cake. I have a feeling I'm going to need them for my hero's feast when I return".

"I'll try, but these mares might eat me out before then".

"You're right Twilight. We've gotta stop this fast"

Speaking of animals, as the hours went by, each of the mares have grown more animalistic. 11533122112112.content:
It was the middle of the afternoon in Hollywood, Miranda and Bonkers were out on typical police duty, writing out tickets for various parking violations. Currently Miranda was exasperated with the toon bob-cat next to her, as her companion was too busy reading a newspaper he obtained.

“Bonkers, are you even hearing me?” asked Miranda, tapping her foot in impatience.
“Wow! This stuff is amazing!” he stated out loud. Getting slightly irritated by the bob-cat’s action, Miranda pulled down the newspaper to see Bonkers’ concealed face.
“Bonkers, you've been reading that paper for the past 20 minutes, would you put it down and help me with some of these parking tickets?” Quickly pulling the newspaper back up to his face, he replied,
“Sure sure, but you gotta read some of these articles Miranda.” Not wanting to be part of his silliness, Miranda snatched the paper out of the toon's hands and continued on with her work. The paper Bonkers was reading belonged to the National Trash, and they were known for not having very reliable sources of information and extremely outlandish news. Nothing but lies were what most people saw it as. However Bonkers and most toons were NOT like most people.

“You can’t believe everything you read, Bonkers,” she answered writing out a ticket, holding the newspaper between her fingers.
“Ah come on Miranda!” Rushing up beside her, attempting to grab the National Trash paper back from his partner, to no avail.
“This stuff is full amazing stories and its in the print! How could a newspaper be lying to us? Maybe if you started reading it, we could be busting down crimes before they even started, why you could even learn something interesting from such hard news. The bob-cat bounced up and down meeting Miranda's gaze.
“Hah-haa. I'm sure "National Trash" is anything but "hard news” Bonkers. I mean look at most of these articles "Elvis seen on tour last night" "Dinosaur spotted eating grass in local park" "Bigfoot revealed to be father of local toon officer bob-cat Bonkers D. Bobcat! " Miranda laughed upon reading that last one.
“Woow I didn't know Bigfoot was my father! ” Bonkers remarked as he began staring at his feet, picking one up to inspect it, hoping to notice any resemblance to the monster's.
"Bonkers! He's not even real, and even if he was you're a toon how could he possibly be your father?" Miranda sighed as it seemed her partner would never understand her reasoning on this phony newspaper.
"Well obviously Miranda Bigfoot is a toon, how else would he have such big feet? Now...gimme back the National Trash pleeease?" Bonkers begged Miranda.
"No Bonkers, you need to help me with these tickets anyway,...so many violators lately." Miranda stuffed the paper into her pants pocket, making sure the toon couldn't get to it and distract him again from his duty. Giving up for now, Bonkers forgot about his favorite piece of newspaper publication
to do as Miranda had asked of him. Bonkers saluted Miranda and started taking his ticket duty more seriously! …As seriously as he could for a toon, of course.

Soon enough it was nearing pitch black out in the streets of the Hollywood, Miranda said good night to Bonkers for a good, albeit slow day of work. and headed for home to end her day. As Miranda arrived at her home and undressed from her uniform, taking the crumbled up newspaper and placing it by her bedside desk. getting out some ingredients to make a quick cup of hot chocolate she re-capped how her day had been for her before thinking out loud, “I wish Bonkers would listen for once about that ridiculous National Trash yawn it's nothing but lies. 11533222211211.content:
You weren't certain what time it was when you were awoken by the sounds of gurgling followed by screaming. You stumble out of bed and attempt to rub the sleep from your eyes. You hastily get dressed and grab your pitchfork, anxious, yet ready to protect your village. You storm out of your cottage. The sky is still dark, but you see light and hear noise coming from the north side of the village. You run to the source of the commotion and nearly retch as the pungent odor singes the hairs in your nostrils.

Fiona the Ogress, formerly the princess of Far Far Away, was straddling the face of one of the townsfolk. It was the butcher. He was once a knight and strongest man in town. You watched as the fat, jiggling ass of this gigantic beast came down on his face. She was so huge that she completely covered the butcher underneath her. Surrounding this scene were dozens of men and women, either unconscious or retching on the ground, many of them with brown skidmarks on their faces. You would soon learned why as you heard a hideous gurgle from the red-headed beast. She giggled and unleashed a soul tearing fart that you're certain has just killed the butcher. She stands, taking the butcher with her as her ass cheeks come together. She yanks his limp form out, causing her cheeks to clap and wobble briefly. She turns and makes eye contact with you as she grins with her yellow teeth.

What do you do?

115332222122211.content:
{Originally written by Jokermask18 on Tuesday, September 4th, 2012, 6:44 PM}

After Prince Charming's defeat and King Artie taking the throne of Far Far away,things had become quite peaceful. Shrek & Fiona were happily raising their new kids and with most of the villains retired, very little trouble had occured lately. Word on the street was they were even converting the Poisin Apple into a family restaurant.

The Princesses had returned to their normal fairy tale lives but while most were contest, Snow White for one was not. Her life was in a rut as she did the same thing every day: Pose for pictures,,sleep with her chosen Prince of the week, try to remember each dwarf's name and constantly avoid apples. Being the Fairest of them all just didn't seem quite so fair anymore.

Snow knew the others wouldn't understand. How could they anyway? They were all the same...except for Fiona. Fiona was the most unconvential Princess Snow had ever met,having chosen to marry and even become a big smelly ogre. While she had nothing against Shrek {she somehow knew she had been in his home once long ago}, she could never get Fiona's choice...until now.

It had been fun to loosen up and try saving someone for a change. And now that she thought about it, Fiona could do that all the time. She could be rude,crude,dirty,and smelly but Shrek only loved her more. She didn't want to be an ogre or anything but Snow couldn't halp but want to experience that for herself.

But where could she start?

Snow decided the best person to speak to was the Ogress herself so she got in her coach and traveled to Shrek's swamp. She found Fiona playing in the mud with her kids and felt an odd emotion she couldn't describe at the scene. Fiona had just grabbed up the triplets in a big hug when she saw her friend. "Hi Snow,what brings you here?" Snow explained the situation and the Ogress grinned. "Sure, I'll help you. Shrek's in town so it's just me and the kids today. Follow me."

They entered the Ogre Couple's home and Fiona...
1153322221222111.title: She goes to Fiona herself for help.

choices: Snow lets Fiona use the potion first.
11533222212221111.content:
{Originally written by Jokermask18 on Saturday, September 15th, 2012, 5:11 PM}

Fiona reached into the cubbord and pulled out a small bottle filled with a gross looking green and brown liquid. Snow could also see an image shaped like Shrek's head imprinted on it. "This was something Shrek found while he filled in for Dad in Far Far Away" Fiona explained to her friend "it's supposedly the same thing that made me an ogre in the first place. They found it when they closed down Fairy Godmother's Potion Factory to build that new Friar Fatboy." "Okay,but why do you have it? Snow asked wiith a raised eyebrow "you and Shrek are already ogres."

Fiona sighed. "It's a long story but a few months before Dad got sick, another Ogress moved closeby to the swamp and started hitting on Shrek. He made it clear he wasn't interested but she just kept it up so finally, I had a word with her one day while Shrek was out running errends. She just laughed it off and told me to fight for Shrek if I wanted to keep him. She challenged me to a belching and farting contest followed by mud wrestling. I accepted and thought I had a good chance since I could give Shrek a run for his money in the gas department but she blew me away on both ends and when we mud wrestled,she beat me easy."

Snow looked surprised at this and Fiona explained "she was bigger...well,fatter than me. She was about as hefty as Shrek and I couldn't really use my moves in wrestling. Luckily for me, Shrek came and fought her off but I hated how easily she beat me. When they gave me the potion to give to Shrek, I hid it and decided that maybe if it could make me more of an ogre, I could challenge her again but then triplits came and I never got the chance."

Fiona got a sad look in her eyes at first but then smiled. "But that's okay,I think you need it more than I do Snow." Snow said nothing and looked at the potion in her hand. Then she looked at Fiona,remembering her friend's story. What would she do?
11533222212221111.title: handed Snow a potion to make her an ogre.

Nothing happened at first but then the slender princess began to swell and fatten,her clothes magically expanding along with her. Her skin turned green,her formally cute nose became a bit bulbous,her white teeth becoming yellowy and stained,and finally her ears morphed into the odd trumpet shape Shrek and all Ogres wer known for. Snow White,fairest of them all,was now a plump,smelly Ogress that was just a tad chubbier than Fiona. Fiona gazed at her friend for a brief moment and asked "Well Snow, how do you feel?"

Snow blinked for a moment and said....
