{Originally written by Jokermask18 on Saturday, September 15th, 2012, 6:27 PM}

Fiona chuckled at her friend's response. "That's normal" she said with a smile "as you can probably tell,we ogres have healthy appetites. The Ogre Princess patted her noicable pot belly and then shuffled to the kitchen to prepare food for Snow. A while later, the two ogresses were seated at a table piled with dishes like fisheye tatar,weedrat on a stick,and many other disgusting delacies fit for ogre consumption. Usually, Snow would have disgusted but now she was drooling at the sight. She and Fiona both dug in but Snow would clearly have won any eating contest the might have had. The formerly petite and well mannered princess piled on dish after dish and inhaled everything in sight like a ravenous animal. Even Fiona winced a bit at the crude display.

When Snow had finished,she had fattened up quite a bit with even pudgier limbs,a massive gut,at leat three chins and even some love handles. All this was contained by her magically altered outfit,which was now covered in stains and crumbs. She was almost bigger than Shrek! "Ugh...that was great, You got any more Fi?"

"Well,I-" "UUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU UURP!!!!" Fiona was cut off by Snow's massive belch while the triplets giggled. Fiona got a mischievious glint in her eye and smirked.

choices: Yeah, you beat me, so you might have a shot.
No, I want to beat her myself.
11533222212221111211.content:
{A/N: Sorry, I've wanted to write this for so long. I just couldn't think of anything until now.}

“Hey, Snow. I’ve got an idea.” Fiona said.

“What?”She asked.

“You might look and eat like an ogress, but I want to see if you can burp like one.” Fiona elaborated with a sly grin.

The ogre princess inhaled and pushed out a repugnant belch that knocked Snow’s yellow ribbon off of her head and ruffled her short black hair. The smell carried by it filled the air, but neither paid it any heed. It ripped for four seconds before finishing. Snow’s light blue eyes just stared for a moment, before returning Fiona’s grin.

“You’re on!” Snow White agreed. “But, just so you know, all that eating gave me a lot more fuel.”

The former Fairest One of Them All clutched her stuffed stomach with her pudgy jade hands and jiggled it violently, shuffling the still-digesting contents inside. A low burbling sound could be heard coming from her flabby belly, one that began frightening Fiona’s children. Fortunately, the menacing growls ceased shortly after, creating an air of silence that ended just as quickly.

“~*BBBEEEEEELLLLLCCCCCCCCHHHHHHH!*~”

Snow’s eructation vastly exceeded Fiona’s, making the mother’s red hair and trumpet-like ears blow back. Its scent overpowered that of Fiona’s belch, stinking up the house even more. The recently transformed princess’s belch outlived her thinner friend’s, lasting an overly long seven seconds. When it ended, Snow gave Fiona a cheeky smile.

“Told you.” She bragged. “I bet you can smell my meal, right?”

Fiona took a whiff to prove Snow’s claim. “Yeah, and it smells delicious.” The ginger replied. “But I’m not done yet.”

She spotted a lit candle and a thought popped into her head. Fiona picked up the stick of wax and, to the surprise of Snow, swallowed it whole! Snow raised her right ebony eyebrow in confusion, but Fiona held up her left hand to stop her from asking.

“Trust me, you’ll see soon.” The domesticated ogress stated.

While Snow waited to find out what that meant, Fiona was feeling a literal fire in her belly building up. Rather than being doused by the native digestive acids, the candle’s flame instead ignited the food inside, setting her entire interior ablaze. Fiona bent down, seemingly in pain, causing her friend to kneel next to her.

“Fiona, you okay?” She inquired with worry.

Immediately, Fiona’s tummy rumbled like an active volcano. To further the comparison, her cheeks swelled and developed a light orange tint, before a blast of fire erupted from her lips.

“~*BBBBBUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRPPPPPPPPPPPP*~”

Fiona’s fiery burp just missed hitting Snow’s face as it shot to the opposite end of the kitchen. Her children’s eyes widened as they stared in awe at the stream of red-orange plasma roaring out of their mother’s mouth like a dragon. The belch rang for approximately eight seconds, heating up the temperature of the room a few degrees. It eventually ended, leaving behind a trail of smoke and the aroma of Fiona’s stomach contents. She looked at her black-haired companion with a smirk once again plastered on her face.

“Care to top that?”

Snow simply gave a nod and proceeded to suck in as much oxygen as she could, ballooning her already packed paunch to an even greater degree. Then, she began to dance, shaking what her generous mother gave her without care of who watched her. While doing so, White rubbed, patted, slapped and even punched her abdominal area.

“A bit early for a victory dance isn’t it?” Fiona snarked, pondering if she should cover her kids eyes.

Snow uttered no response, continuing her impromptu performance. Unbeknownst to Fiona, there was an ulterior motive behind it. The rhythmic gyrating of her body swished and sloshed the dissolving food in White’s gut. Also, Snow White’s years of singing at the top of her lungs had enhanced her diaphragm and lung power, which when coupled with her current state as an ogress and the utter anarchy occurring in her abdomen, would make for an interesting combination. After a few minutes of shifting and swirling, Snow felt the pressure within her accumulate too its peak and felt like now was the time to release it. She ended one part of her show, but the next was about to begin.

“~*BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBEEEEEEEEEEELLLLLLLLLLLLLLCCCCCCCCCCCCHHHHHHHH HHH*~”

Effortlessly, Snow let her red lips be rippled apart by a beastly belch that dwarfed every pervious one and all aspects. It gradually grew in volume, shattering every glass object in the room. It sounded more akin to an ogress roar than an actually burp, scaring the triplets. Snow’s taste buds experienced a case of déjà vu, as a torrent of odors rushed across her tongue, bringing back the flavors from her feast for her to savor again.

“Heh. Tasted better the second time.” Snow thought.

Fiona wasn’t left out of the fun though. The green fog of foulness flew toward her, penetrating her nostril and actually forcing her to pinch her nose. Unfortunately, this left her unable to protect her eardrums from the deafening howls of Snow White’s expelled gas. Fiona’s eyes watered as she waited for her friend to stop. Thankfully, after 10 grueling seconds, her wish was granted. Though echoes of the belch still rang throughout the house, the burp itself had faded into nonexistence. Snow folded her arms, her red-cheeked face grinning in victory over her opponent.

“Looks like I’m ogre enough, don’t you think?” She asked rhetorically.

Fiona was coughing from the lingering fumes, fighting the urge to spill her recent meal all over the floor. “Yeah, you’re a real ogre alright.”

Snow offered a hand as a sign of good sportsmanship, which Fiona gladly shook. Afterwards, all of the windows were opened to air out the house (a rare instance considering its normal occupants), and Snow White approached Fiona with a question.

“So, Fiona. You mentioned an ogress beating you a while back.”

“Yeah.” She replied.

“Well, what if I took her on in your place?”

Fiona stopped to think about this, before deciding...

115332222211221.content:
The young bride-to-be Susan Murphy’s wedding day had taken a turn for the worst. For starters, she was struck by a meteorite. Then at the altar, she began to grow, but not in height – in weight.

Her appendages thickened with flab but also built an equally thick layer of muscle underneath, soon reaching a diameter of 1 foot. The same thing happened with her fingers and toes, except they were only twice as wide as before. White replaced the brunette in her hair and her facial cheeks swelled with fat. She gained a second chin as her neck vanished in a coat of fat. The ivory wedding dress stretched and tore as her melons grew to the size of actual melons and her ass inflated to rival basketballs. Sue’s navel popped outward as did her stomach, until it approached the size of medicine ball. By the time her transformation had concluded, all of the attendants had already fled the church, including the groom.

Ms. Murphy gasped as tears swelled in her eyes. Before she could start the waterworks, a group of military personnel rushed into the nigh vacant room and launched a powerful sedative at her. It nailed in the thigh and Susan’s vision & hearing blurred before she blacked out.

--

Susan could only see darkness and heard an alarm go off.

“Honey, could you hit the snooze?” Susan asked groggily.

She turned to her other side and tried to drown out the noise.

“Baby, why did you set the alarm? We're on our honeymoon.” She continued before falling to the floor.

The woman raised her head and looked around her. She was in a dark area that flashed red. What was behind her was a large gray bed with a white pillow that she’d presumably fallen off of. Gazing upward, Sue saw a blinking crimson alarm. Observing her outfit, she could tell that she was wearing a snug long-sleeved dark grey jumpsuit with orange stripes on her shoulders and the side of her legs. There were orange-colored pockets on her breasts, the number ‘00005’ just above the left pocket and an orange ‘?’ sign on the side of her upper right arm. Although she couldn’t see her feet, they were covered in orange and white Converse sneakers.

“Hello? What's going on?” She question before she saw her bed retract into the wall.

Then, a metal door slammed shut on the other end. A small cranking was heard before the room shifted down like an elevator. Susan felt her padded belly, butt, and breasts wobble as bright, white lights shined briefly through a glass window in the door. Susan crept up to the opposite wall in fear before the room suddenly stopped, the laws of physics dictating that she drop to the floor again. The beeping and flashing ceased as well and the alarmed receded into the ceiling. The weighty woman still shook like a lost puppy, until a whirring sound occurred followed by the opening of the door. Ms. Murphy could see a massive light grey area lit by several ivory lights. She could just barely make what appeared to be two tables. Immediately afterwards, the wall that Sue leaned on pushed her into the new room, her frightened stammers not stopping it. She panted heavily when it did stop, then got up and cautiously waddled around.

“Hello?” She called out, the door shutting once more behind her.

She made her way to the tables before hearing something faint.

“Is it just legs? Did they capture a giant pair of legs?” A voice asked.

“Silence, B.O.B! She'll hear us!” A second voice stated.

“How? Legs don't have ears.” ‘B.O.B’ replied.

“Just shush!”

Sue motioned toward the source of the sound with more caution.

“Hello? Is there someone there? Could you tell me where I am?” She inquired.

Another strange sound emanated from the center of the room, which made Ms. Murphy whip her head back toward the table. There, a thin tube dispensed beige mush and a spoon onto the larger one with a metal coffee mug before retreating out of sight. The fat-laden maiden went back to the table and grabbed the spoon. For some reason, she found the oatmeal-looking slop rather appetizing. However, she turned her head away when she heard the sound of tiny pitter-patters on the floor.

“Hello? What was that?”

Trying to refocus on the oddly tantalizing slop laid before her, Susan took a seat on the reinforced steel bench near the table, her ass overflowing the seat that could fit two. She then heard the same noise again and it was louder this time. She turned around once more and the next thing that she saw almost made her faint.

“Hello.” The creature greeted with a bow.

“Ew!” Susan responded before clutching her gut in pain.

She felt a cluster of gas worm its way up her throat. Despite covering the only vent it had to leave, the pressure soon became too much.

~*BBBBBUUUUURRRRPPPPPP!*~
The monster was fortunate to duck out of Sue’s general direction as the power burp blast broke the sound barrier and smashed into the super steel wall, leaving a 49’ 11” wide hole in it. Susan's face turned tomato red in embarassment.

“Whatever mad scientist made you... he really went all-out.” The bug-man complimented, peaking his head out from behind Susan’s table.

“You can talk.” Ms. Murphy said in disbelief.

“Missing Link, when did we get a hole installed?” A man-sized blue mass of jelly with one eye questioned, arriving with a green fish-ape.

“We didn’t B.O.B. That was the work of the new girl.” The fish-ape corrected.

“ Forgive him, but as you can see, he has no brain.” Dr. Cockroach commented about B.O.B.

“Turns out, you don't need one! Totally overrated! As a matter of fact, I don't even have to... *gasp* I forgot how to breathe! Don't know how to breathe! Help me, Dr Cockroach! Help!” B.O.B. pleaded loudly.

“Suck in, B.O.B.” Dr. Cockroach told, exasperated.

B.O.B. then started to breathe normally.

“Thanks, Doc. You're a lifesaver.”

“Might we ask for your name, madam?” The Doctor asked.

“Susan.” She replied.

“No, no, no, we mean your monster name. What do people scream when they see you coming? You know, like "Look out! Here comes..."?” B.O.B.

There was a moment of silence.

“Susan.” She answered.

“Really?” Dr. Cockroach responded.

“‘SUUUUSAAAN!’” B.O.B. repeated spookily. “Ooh, I just scared myself! That is scary!”

Before the conversation could further develop, a door over 350 feet tall opened partially. Out of the darkness appeared a man on a jetpack.

“Monsters. Get back in your cells.” He ordered.

The three smaller ones begrudgingly obeyed, walking toward three open doors that soon closed afterward.

“Oh, thank goodness! A real person!” Murphy exclaims in relief before noticing his jetpack. “You are a real person, right? You're not one of those half-person, half-machine, you know. Whatever you call those things?”

“A cyborg?” He replied dryly.

“Oh, no! YOU'RE A CYBORG!” The 350 pound female shouted, panicked.

“Madam, I assure you I am not a cyborg. The name is General W. R. Monger. I'm in charge of this facility.” He explained before turning around.
“Now follow me. It is time for your orientation.”

Although, she was much hungrier after that burp, Susan reluctantly followed Monger out of the room and onto a moving pad.

“In 1950, it was decided that Jane and Joe Public could not handle the truth about monsters and that they should focus on more important things like paying taxes, and so the government convinced the world monsters were stuff of myth and legend and then locked them away in this here facilty.”

Another door opened, showing darkness. The pad that Sue was on lowered slightly before turning left.

“But I’m not a monster. I’m just a regular person. I’m not a danger to anyone or anything.”

As if trying to undermine Ms. Murphy’s argument, her posterior rumbled for a bit before shooting a supersonic air bullet that downed a faraway helicopter.

“Sorry.” She apologized meekly before the pad moved upward and entered yet another door. “How long will I be here?”

“Indefinitely.” The General replied.

“Can I contact my parents?” Sue asked.

“No.”

“Derek?”

“Negative.”

“Do they know where I am?”

Monger turned to face her.

“No, and they never will! This place is an X-File, wrapped in a cover-up and deep-fried in a paranoid conspiracy! There will be zero contact with the outside world.”

The pad entered another empty space, then turned right. After passing the monsters that she ment earlier, they stopped at a closed door that opened to reveal a room similar to the one that Susie woke up in.

“Oh, and uh, one other thing. The government has changed your name to Slobica.” Monger said as the door closed behind Susan.

1212111.content:
For the longest time, Charlotte and Templeton usually got along, in their own way. Even when Wilbur showed up to the farm, this was the case for some time. But as time went on, Templeton began making snide remarks in front of the two and this slowly started to get on Charlotte's nerves. While Charlotte was usually nice and caring towards the animals like Wilbur, the remarks were starting to get on her nerves and she wanted to do something about it. But she didn't know how.

Until one day, she spotted Wilbur's trough still being slightly full and got an idea in her head. One morning in the Mushroom Kingdom, Princess Peach was casually walking outside the castle. It was a beautiful day, and seeing there hasn’t been any sightings of Bowser or his minions, the princess decided there was no reason she couldn't walk around her own kingdom. Along the way she came across something yellow peeking out through the grass, something that got her curious all of a sudden. Peach moved over towards it, and pulled away the grass and moss that was covering the thing.

It was a question mark block, old and faded, lying on the ground; she'd never seen one so old. She decided there was no reason she couldn't try hitting it and seeing what popped out. It was possible that there could be a poison mushroom inside; but those were clearly marked and could only hurt you if you dared to eat one.

She popped the bottom of the block with her silk gloved fist, and with a faded version of the usual sound they made a mushroom popped out the top. It seemed to be a 1UP mushroom, though the green was a little darker than she'd seen before. Peach smelled it, and it seemed to be fresh enough. She could always use an extra life, and so bit into the fungus. It was more bitter and spicy than other 1UP mushroom's she'd eaten, which were usually overwhelmingly sweet. Peach waited a few seconds and shrugged. She didn't feel sick, in fact, she felt nothing different; maybe it’s power had worn out long ago.

Either way Peach simple shrugged it off and continued her walk. But unknown to her, someone or thing was watching in the bushes close by.

1352121111.content:
Princess Fiona was taking a stroll through her swamp home, taking in the disgusting, yet appealing sights, sounds and smells. As she continued her trek, she stopped to see someone resting on a log. She had short blonde hair, wore a plain white t-shirt and blue pants, and was covered in mud and sweat. The woman was also fat, like almost as fat as Fiona. This girl looked like she’d be a worthy opponent for what Fiona had in mind. That notion, coupled with the ogress’s general curiosity and kindness, compelled her to approach the stranger.

“Hi. Who are you?” The princess greeted with a wave of her left hand.

Cameron was pulled out of her thoughts when she heard someone who sounded like… herself? She turned around to face the big green woman and yelped in shock as she was actually meeting the fictional character whom she had most frequently portrayed. Fiona however took this differently.

“Oh, I’m sorry if I spooked you.” Fiona apologized. “It’s just that you were sitting in the middle of my swamp by yourself and I thought you were lonely.”

After the initial shock wore off, Cameron regained her composure and heaved her fat ass off the log. Even with everything that had already happened to her today, meeting a character that she’d played multiple times in person was still a bit much to wrap her brain around. Nevertheless, Diaz was willing to display a basic level of manners and walked over to shake Fiona’s hand.

“No, it’s fine.” The actress replied. “I’m just surprised that there was someone else out here.”

“Yeah, not many people visit. My husband it that way, but I’m friendlier around others.”

Cameron was about to comment, but was interrupted by a bubble of gas surging blasting past her lips. The belch blew back Fiona’s braided red hair and carried with it a scent of swamp slugs that she was also familiar with. Cameron put a hand up to her mouth, but then remembered who she was in the presence of and dropped it. However, Fiona simply laughed in response.

“Hahaha. So, you’re the one who let out that echoing burp earlier.” She giggled.

“Oh, you heard that?”Cameron asked.

“Sure. Even the deaf would’ve heard that!” The ogress answered. “In fact, I was out here looking for whoever let that beauty out.”

“What do you mean?” Cameron inquired. “Do you want to have a burping contest?”

Fiona’s answer came in the form of an asymmetrical smirk, a crooked eyebrow and a burp that made the rest of swamp smell good in comparison and blew Cameron’s flabby frame back a few feet.

“Consider that a yes.”

Cameron stared at her with a bizarre mix of respect for her gaseous outburst and oddly some distain. You see, while the former model enjoyed the success that she'd garnered from playing the big green redhead in four financially successful films and two average TV specials since 2001, that had also been a bit of a detriment to her career. As the Shrek films were more approachable to most general audiences than some of Diaz’s other notable movies, a lot more people are bound to recognize her more as ‘Princess Fiona’ rather than ‘Natalie Cook’ from Charlie’s Angels or ‘Tina Carlyle’ from The Mask. Seeing people hound her for autographs was already in and of itself very bothersome, but having the majority of those only know the most famous jobs that you had on top of that was on a whole new level of insulting. Then, her eyes widened in realization.

"Wait a minute..." The blonde thought.

Perhaps this was supposed to represent another thing entirely. It seemed more than a little bit coincidental that she was having a dream specifically set in these films. Perhaps Cameron still had some form of resentment against this character in particular and now she was given the opportunity to exact a kind of retribution against Fiona for inadvertently pigeonholing her. Then, she might be able to move on with her life.

Or it could have something to do with that waffle house and this dream was pure happenstance.

Either way, this was truly something that didn’t happen often, and whether this was a result of her recent transformation or just bottled-up resentment, Cameron felt compelled to take advantage of it. She merely looked back at Fiona and gave a cocky half-smile that matched the green-clad regal figure. This should be interesting.

1353312.content:
“And just like that, we’re done!”

Sitting in her gaming den and studio was a YouTuber called Shauntelle Kikue, better known as MasaeAnela or Masae for short, who had recently finished a long playthrough session of Super Mario 64. Satisfied with her casual playthrough, she slowly lifted herself away from her chair to switch the console and tv off.

“Alright, now I just gotta edit all this footage and-,” she said before looking outside her window to the morning sun replaced with nightfall. “Aw geez, I didn’t realise how late it was!” she exclaimed in surprise.

With her hands on her hips, Masae let out a deep sigh of embarrassment before quickly bringing herself back up. “No biggie, I can get this done tomorrow and everyone will get to see this juicy finale of mine.”

This hasn’t been the first time this sort of thing has happened before, where she has been completely engaged in a game and losing track of time. Plus, while she was busy playing and providing her self-contained commentary, the YouTuber also didn’t realise she had made a mess in her room while doing so. For whatever reason, Masae had developed a habit of collecting a lot of food and drinks that were easily accessible in her reach without making her leave frequently from her records. And because of that, she had developed a bit of a pot-belly.

Pulling the curtains by her window, Masae soon turned her attention to her console and pulled the N64 cartridge out. “You certainly kept me busy,” she teased.

Then something expected happened, the cartridge in her hand suddenly began to glow intensively before hovering above Masae’s hand.

“What in the-?!” Masae yelled in shock.

Masae could only watch as the cartridge continued to glow brighter by second until the cartridge transformed into a vortex that suddenly began to suck anything into it. Masae quickly grabbed the curtains to prevent herself from getting pulled inside but the vortex was too strong as it ripped the curtain railing off the wall.

“AAAAAAAAAAHHHHHH!!!” Masae shouted before she was pulled inside the spinning N64 vortex.

Once she was inside, the vortex suddenly disappeared and reverted into the Super Mario 64 cartridge again that fell onto the floor. Masae didn’t know what was happening as she found herself aimlessly spinning around in a glowing blue void.

It didn’t last long as Masae saw something approaching her inside the void. Closing her eyes and shielding herself from whatever impact that was about to happen, instead, Masae found herself shooting out of the void and landing headfirst into the ground of a field of sorts.

“Ooowww…” she groaned aloud from the pain, her legs wiggling around as she tried to pull herself out of her predicament.

The vortex hovering behind her suddenly faded away, leaving her alone into this strange place she had been whisked away. It wasn’t long until she managed to pluck herself out of the ground.

“Uurgghh… That was a thing,” she remarked while rubbing her sore head. “What just happened and where…”

Though she was asking herself those questions, she soon discovered where she ended up. On looking around her surroundings, she found herself in a place that she instantly recognised from all the times she had seen or played; never imagined herself to be in.

A hilly, grassy area with several trees and over in front of her was a tall castle with a lovely stained-glass window. She was at the castle grounds of Princess Peach’s castle.

“Oh my god…” she uttered slowly, almost falling over from shock. “I’m in the game!”

And that wasn’t the only thing that was bizarre of her situation as she noticed she was wearing different clothes to the one she was wearing earlier in her room. For whatever reason, she was wearing clothes that were identical to Mario’s. Hat included.

It was as if someone had magically swapped her sweater and jeans upon arriving in this place.

“Oh my god! Lakitu!” Masae immediately gushed sweetly at the cloud riding turtle creature. “Just like in the game too. Hehe, maybe I should have skipped bridge in that case.”
